definition: full-time/to appoint sb to a specific task
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: He is a full-time teacher in our school.
sentences.chinese: 他是我们学校的专任老师。

sentences.english: I. Language Instructor Christian Hein's application for change of appointment as full-time assistant professor.
sentences.chinese: 汉骏纬语言讲师改聘专任助理教授申请案，提请讨论。

sentences.english: School of existing staff 200 people, full-time teachers, nearly 160 people.
sentences.chinese: 学校现有教职员工200多人，专任教师近160人。

sentences.english: The existing staff 150 people, including 98 full-time teachers.
sentences.chinese: 现有教职员工150人，其中专任教师98人。

definition: to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to hold an office or post
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to fill a post/to act as
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
